skill.name: humanizer
skill.description: Remove signs of AI-generated writing from text. Use when editing or reviewing text to make it sound more natural and human-written. Based on Wikipedia's comprehensive 'Signs of AI writing' guide. Detects and fixes 24 patterns including inflated symbolism, promotional language, superficial -ing analyses, vague attributions, em dash overuse, rule of three, AI vocabulary words, negative parallelisms, and excessive conjunctive phrases.
skill.summary: A writing editor skill that identifies and removes AI-generated text patterns to make content sound more natural and human.
skill.author: softaworks

security_audit.summary: All 44 static analysis findings were evaluated and determined to be false positives. The 'external_commands' detections are Markdown code blocks showing installation instructions. The 'network' findings are legitimate Wikipedia citation URLs. The 'filesystem' references are standard Claude Code skill paths. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' flags incorrectly triggered on the word 'algorithm' in the context of LLM statistical algorithms. This skill contains only documentation with writing guidance - no executable scripts, no network calls, and no malicious patterns.

content.value_statement: AI-generated text often contains recognizable patterns that make it sound robotic and inauthentic. This skill helps you identify and remove 24 common AI writing patterns, transforming sterile content into natural, human-sounding prose that connects with readers.
actual_capabilities: Identifies 24 distinct AI writing patterns based on Wikipedia's research
Rewrites inflated promotional language into neutral, factual statements
Removes vague attributions and replaces them with specific sources
Eliminates overused AI vocabulary words like 'testament', 'landscape', 'crucial'
Fixes mechanical formatting issues like em dash overuse and title case headings
Adds authentic voice and personality to sterile, voiceless text
limitations: Requires manual review to ensure rewritten text maintains original meaning
Cannot detect all AI patterns in highly technical or specialized content
May need multiple iterations for text with many AI patterns
Does not verify factual claims - only improves writing style

use_cases.title: Polish AI-Generated Drafts
use_cases.description: Content creators use this skill to refine AI-generated blog posts, articles, and marketing copy into authentic-sounding prose that readers trust and engage with.

use_cases.title: Edit Business Communications
use_cases.description: Professionals humanize AI-assisted emails, reports, and presentations to ensure their communications sound genuine and avoid the generic tone that undermines credibility.

use_cases.title: Improve Academic Writing
use_cases.description: Students and researchers remove AI patterns from drafts to ensure their writing meets academic integrity standards while maintaining clarity and proper attribution.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Humanize
prompt_templates.prompt: Humanize this text: [paste your text here]

prompt_templates.title: Full Document Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Please review this document and humanize any AI-sounding patterns. Show me what changed and why: [paste document]

prompt_templates.title: Specific Pattern Fix
prompt_templates.prompt: This text sounds too promotional. Please rewrite it to be more neutral and factual: [paste text]

prompt_templates.title: Batch Processing
prompt_templates.prompt: I have multiple sections to humanize. Please process each one and maintain consistent voice throughout. Here are the sections: [paste sections]

Moreover, it provides a seamless, intuitive, and powerful user experience—ensuring that users can accomplish their goals efficiently. Industry experts believe this will have a lasting impact on the entire sector.
output_examples.output: The software update adds batch processing, keyboard shortcuts, and offline mode. Early feedback from beta testers has been positive, with most reporting faster task completion.

output_examples.output: Alamata Raya Kobo is a town in the Gonder region of Ethiopia, known for its weekly market and 18th-century church.

output_examples.output: The French Revolution began in 1789 when financial crisis and food shortages led to widespread unrest.

best_practices: Always review the humanized output to ensure the original meaning is preserved
Provide context about the intended audience and tone for better results
Use specific examples from your industry to help the skill match your voice
anti_patterns: Do not use this skill to disguise plagiarized content as original work
Avoid applying humanization to text that requires strict technical precision
Do not skip fact-checking just because the text sounds more natural

faq.question: What is the Humanizer skill based on?
faq.answer: This skill is based on Wikipedia's 'Signs of AI writing' guide, maintained by WikiProject AI Cleanup. The patterns documented come from observations of thousands of instances of AI-generated text on Wikipedia.

faq.question: How many AI writing patterns does this skill detect?
faq.answer: The skill identifies 24 distinct patterns organized into five categories: Content Patterns, Language and Grammar Patterns, Style Patterns, Communication Patterns, and Filler and Hedging patterns.

faq.question: Will this skill make my text shorter?
faq.answer: Often yes. AI-generated text tends to be verbose with filler phrases and inflated language. Humanization typically produces more concise, direct writing while preserving all key information.

faq.question: Can this skill help with text I wrote myself?
faq.answer: Yes. Even human-written text can unconsciously adopt AI-like patterns, especially if you've been reading a lot of AI-generated content. The skill helps identify and remove these habits.

faq.question: Does this skill check facts or just style?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on writing style and patterns, not fact-checking. It will remove vague attributions like 'Experts believe' but does not verify whether specific claims are true.

faq.question: Can I use this for academic or professional writing?
faq.answer: Yes, but use judgment. The skill helps remove AI patterns that undermine credibility. However, always ensure the final text meets any specific style guides or requirements for your field.
